column4: Can I install ubuntu withouth altering existing partition table?
no
Jordan_U: I have another linux distro. and I want ubuntu to be installed on /dev/sda7 , other partitions unchanged.
so you have a prepared place for it?
if that is the case then still no unless you also have prepared a swap space
it will still alter existing partition table, which was your question
so there is just no way
if you prepared (PRE) a space for /, and for swap, then yes and no,,, no only by technicality
if you had set up for prior, then the partition table is "changed" but to the way you designed
not sure what you are really asking,,, so i am being direct to your question
I do not care about other OS (if it is bootable afterwards or no). I just want to install ubuntu say on /dev/sda7 and preserve data thatas on /dev/sda8 withouth having to backup.
You mean if I had a free space instead of /dev/sda7 I could install ubuntu there withouth touching /dev/sda8?
no, not what i  mean
and yes,,, but would change the partition table that was your original question

jordan_U: basically what I want is following. right now I have two partitions /dev/sda7 and /dev/sda8. my home (GBs of data) is mounted on /dev/sda8 everything else (/etc /boot /log ...) is on /dev/sda7.  I want to install ubuntu on /dev/sda7 and I want all the data to be left untouched on /dev/sda8 (mount it later as my home directory). Is it doable with ubuntu installer or would I have to backup entyre home directory and write it bac
but that leaves the question,, where do you install grub?
yes do-able, never advisable without backup,, but yes
alternate cd has more config options in install
If I created some free space on my device, would I be able to install ubuntu there and mount already existing ext3 partitions afterwards?
ok, example only!,,, i have a 160gb hd mounted as /home,, another 160gb hd mounted as /var, which are both in the file-system
I have both partitions on the same hd. I guess my only option is to make the actual backup.
well, i would suggest that anyway, but, you seem to know what you are doing , and if you know for sure where to install and what to mount others as,,, well its up to you,,,
thanks
i hope i helped,,, you can find me in #SeaPhor or #Digital-it
